CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1967, pg. 17, reads: "STRIKING - Two of the most striking outfits modeled at the NULBA [National United Licensed Beverage Association] Fashion Show at Chatham Center, were designed and created by Alberta Thompson (left). She is wearing a black velvet form - fitting Chinese style ensemble with matching hat trimmed in rhinestones. Long dangling rhinestone earrings completed her attire.  The white brocade coat trimmed in feathers worn by Glora [sic] Grate was also created by the talented and pretty Alberta. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Gloria Golden Grate modeling white brocade coat trimmed in feathers, posed in Chatham Center for NULBA [Tavern Owners] fashion show
